title: Find a table of values from a definite integral

content.question: For all values of x, the continuous function f is positive and decreasing. Let g be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>âˆ«</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4462@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following could be a table of values for g ?

choices.label: The figure shows a table with 4 rows and 2 columns. Column 1 is labeled x. Column 2 is labeled g of x. Moving through the three rows that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows:   Row 1: x, 1, g of x, negative 2  Row 2: x, 2, g of x, 0  Row 3: x, 3, g of x, 1

The figure shows a table with 4 rows and 2 columns. Column 1 is labeled x. Column 2 is labeled g of x. Moving through the three rows that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows:   Row 1: x, 1, g of x, negative 2  Row 2: x, 2, g of x, 0  Row 3: x, 3, g of x, 3

The figure shows a table with 4 rows and 2 columns. Column 1 is labeled x. Column 2 is labeled g of x. Moving through the three rows that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows:   Row 1: x, 1, g of x, 1  Row 2: x, 2, g of x, 0  Row 3: x, 3, g of x, negative 2

The figure shows a table with 4 rows and 2 columns. Column 1 is labeled x. Column 2 is labeled g of x. Moving through the three rows that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows:   Row 1: x, 1, g of x, 2  Row 2: x, 2, g of x, 0  Row 3: x, 3, g of x, negative 1

The figure shows a table with 4 rows and 2 columns. Column 1 is labeled x. Column 2 is labeled g of x. Moving through the three rows that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows:   Row 1: x, 1, g of x, 3  Row 2: x, 2, g of x, 0  Row 3: x, 3, g of x, 2

content.answer: The figure shows a table with 4 rows and 2 columns. Column 1 is labeled x. Column 2 is labeled g of x. Moving through the three rows that contain data from left to right, the data are as follows:   Row 1: x, 1, g of x, negative 2  Row 2: x, 2, g of x, 0  Row 3: x, 3, g of x, 1

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
